alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued July 21 at 5:41PM MDT until July 21 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 645 PM MDT. * At 540 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was along I-10 near and west of Lordsburg and Steins. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging winds in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 21. Locations impacted include... Steins, Lordsburg, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa, Shakespeare and Pyramid Mountains. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
